message.content:
The carrying amount of inventories sold during the reporting period is typically represented by the "Cost of Goods Sold" line item in the income statement.

Given the problem:

| Account           | Amount     | Date       |
|-------------------|------------|------------|
| Main Business Revenue | 2637011.03 | 2024-02-05 |
| Total Revenue     | 2637011.03 | 2024-02-05 |
| Cost of Goods Sold| 1015000.00 | 2024-02-05 |
| Total Cost       | 1015000.00 | 2024-02-05 |
| Gross Profit     | 1622011.03 | 2024-02-05 |
| Administrative Expenses | 136536.97 | 2024-02-05 |
| Selling Expenses | 402699.98 | 2024-02-05 |
| Depreciation     | 92870.67 | 2024-02-05 |
| Financial Expenses | 37809.98 | 2024-02-05 |
| Total Expenses   | 669917.60 | 2024-02-05 |
| Interest Income  | 15023.59 | 2024-02-05 |
| Profit Before Tax| 967117.02 | 2024-02-05 |
| Tax Expense      | 131850.51 | 2024-02-05 |
| Net Profit       | 835266.51 | 2024-02-05 |

From the above, the carrying amount of inventories sold (Cost of Goods Sold) is 1,015,000.00.

```json
{"solution": {"value": "1015000.00"}}
```
